entry.title: Fortune Blossoms・桜みくじ
entry.content:
These are not flowers. These are pink colored pieces of paper – fortunes – tied on metal wires and arranged to resemble cherry blossoms.

At Heian Jingu, shown here, and at other shrines and temples it is popular to pull a fortune. The fortunes generally have five levels of luck/unluck. If you get a fortune of bad luck, you tie it in a knot at the shrine, so the bad luck does not come home with you.

これらは桜の花ではありません。これらは桜の花を模したように配置された、ピンク色のおみくじです。平安神宮にて。

entry.title: River Morning・川朝
entry.content:
A flat-bottom Yakatabune boat takes visitors on a ride along the Oi River in Arashiyama. Piloted with only a bamboo pole, it is a calm, peaceful ride.

In the deep river gorge, the morning sun only reaches the boat, the rocks, and the maple leaves, while the far side of the river and the opposite bank are in shadow; creating a high contrast look. The boat is translucent, so it gets illuminated by the sun as well.

嵐山の大堰川を、平底の屋形船で遊覧する。竹竿一本で操縦する、穏やかな船旅です。

深い渓谷の中で、朝日は船と岩ともみじにしか届かず、川の向こう側と対岸は影になり、コントラストが高い。ボートは半透明なので、太陽に照らされている。
